meanings.definition: The improper joining of parties or causes in a legal action.
meanings.sent1: The misjoinder of the wrong parties in the lawsuit caused confusion.
meanings.sent2: The judge had to address the misjoinder of the unrelated claims in the court case.
meanings.sent3: The misjoinder of the cat and the dog in the legal document made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: Her misjoinder of reality and fantasy in the case was like mixing oil and water.
meanings.sent5: The misjoinder of the facts was like trying to fit a square peg into a round hole.

meanings.definition: A mistake in joining two or more parties in a legal proceeding.
meanings.sent1: The misjoinder of the plaintiff and defendant was a critical error.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer realized the misjoinder of the clients too late.
meanings.sent3: The misjoinder of the witness and the judge was a hilarious mix-up.
meanings.sent4: His misjoinder of the key evidence was like missing a piece of a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The misjoinder of the parties was a knot that needed unraveling in court.
